greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total sum of parts of multiplicity 2 in all partitions of n.
comment: For m > 0, column m of A222730 is asymptotic to sqrt(3) * (2*m+1) * exp(Pi*sqrt(2*n/3)) / (2 * m^2 * (m+1)^2 * Pi^2) ~ 6 * (2*m+1) * n * p(n) / (m^2 * (m+1)^2 * Pi^2), where p(n) is the partition function A000041(n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, May 29 2018
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: G.f. for total sum of parts of multiplicity m in all partitions of n is (x^m/(1-x^m)^2-x^(m+1)/(1-x^(m+1))^2)/Product(1-x^i,i=1..infinity).
a(n) ~ 5 * sqrt(3) * exp(Pi*sqrt(2*n/3)) / (72 * Pi^2). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, May 29 2018
example: a(5) = 3 because the partitions of 5 that have parts with multiplicity 2 are [3,1,1] and [2,2,1] and the sum of those parts is 1+2 = 3.
mathematica: b[n_, p_] := b[n, p] = If[n == 0 && p == 0, {1, 0}, If[p == 0, Array[0&, n+2], Sum[Function[l, ReplacePart[l, m+2 -> p*l[[1]] + l[[m+2]]]][Join[b[n-p*m, p-1], Array[0&, p*m]]], {m, 0, n/p}]]]; a[n_] := b[n, n][[4]]; a[0] = a[1] = 0; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 50}]   (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 24 2014, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Column k=2 of A222730. - _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 03 2013
results.author: _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 26 2006
